simplesect.para: Requirement is not satisfied

Requirement is not verified After having received a valid request 0x28 with subfunction != 0x00 and != 0x01 (valid means that according to Q-LAH_80124-6545 session check was ok (non-default session), security check was ok (no protection required))
and signal PreconditionCheck indicates state OBD_Driving_Cycle_setOnce
AND
(ESP_21.ESP_v_Signal <= 5 km/h (with 2s debounce time) OR ESP_21.ESP_v_Signal == Init or Fehler or Unterspannung OR ESP_21 timeout)
AND
( (Motor_14.MO_HYB_Fahrbereitschaft == 0 OR Motor_14 timeout) AND (Motor_54.MO_Fahrbereitschaft == 0 OR Motor_54 timeout) )
FBL_SafePrecondition shall reject the request with NRC 0x22 if the preconditions are not fulfilled..
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_997 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_128
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: FUNC ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/inc/DiagAppl_DEM_ExtendedData.h line 565 Requirement is satisfied here: FUNC ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/src/DiagAppl_DCM_Service10.c line 140 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/test/swut/DiagAppl_DCM_Service10.c.test line 302 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/test/swut/DiagAppl_DEM_ExtendedData.c.test line 429 Preconditions
The ICAS1 shall check the following precondition only in order to change from a non-default session in application mode to programming session in bootloader mode (0x10 02 request)
[Condition Vehicle Speed; ESP_v_Signal <= 5 km/h]
This precondition is NOT applicable for the rest of the SessionControlRequests.
Remark: The preconditions are to be checked depend on the session transition as follows. - From non-default Session in Application mode to Programming Session in Bootloader Mode, check preconditions listed in transition to programming session. - All other transitions, no preconditions checked.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_128 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_129
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: FUNC ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/src/DiagAppl_DCM_Service10.c line 141 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/test/swut/DiagAppl_DCM_Service10.c.test line 303 Request and processing
IF the ICAS1 receives the following request
THEN the ICAS1 shall: - Check if the [Preconditions] apply and if they are fulfilled. - Check if the requested transition is allowed - If the previous checks are passed, and the transition does not imply mode change, then - The ICAS1 changes to the requested session - The ICAS1 sends a positive response to the client if the bit SupressPosResponse in the request is not set
- If the previous checks are not passed, the ICAS1 shall respond with the corresponding NRC to the check which failed, listed in the Negative Response codes for this service
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_129 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

The ICAS1 shall allow the following session transitions while it is in Application mode
Transition 12 and 30 - From any to default session. Request: 10 01
Transition 10 and 14 - From any to Extended Request: 10 03
Transition 09 and 15 - from any to EOL Request: 10 40
Transition 16 and 31 - from any to Development Request: 10 4F
Remark: It should be no security access level required for any transition between sessions.
For further information on transitions between session, see L3_CRoute_5237
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_133 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_136
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: FUNC ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/src/DiagAppl_DCM_Service10.c line 145 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/test/swut/DiagAppl_DCM_Service10.c.test line 307 Transition 13 + 2 + 5: From Application to Bootloader reprogramming session
If the ICAS1 is in a non-default session in application mode, and it receives a request to change to programming mode (10 02), then the ICAS1 shall perform following sequence to change to programming session in bootloader mode:
- Store a request proof manner of the request received - Send a negative response 0x78 (response pending) - Perform a reset
After startup, the ICAS1 checks the progRequest and as it is set to true, then the ICAS1 - resets the reprogramming request, setting progRequest back to false and - Sends the positive response 50 02 to acknowledge the tester that the transition to ECUProgrammingSession is successful - enters ECUProgrammingSession in bootloader mode.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_136 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

If the ICAS1 is in a non-default session in application mode, and it receives a request to change to programming mode (10 02), then the ICAS1 shall perform following sequence to change to programming session in bootloader mode:
- Store a request proof manner of the request received - Send a negative response 0x78 (response pending) - Perform a reset
After startup, the ICAS1 checks the progRequest and as it is set to true, then the ICAS1 - resets the reprogramming request, setting progRequest back to false and - Sends the positive response 50 02 to acknowledge the tester that the transition to ECUProgrammingSession is successful - enters ECUProgrammingSession in bootloader mode.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_139 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_140
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: FUNC ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/src/DiagAppl_DCM_Service10.c line 147 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/test/swut/DiagAppl_DCM_Service10.c.test line 309 Transition 21-19 + 34: From Bootloader to Default session in Application mode
If the ICAS1 is in any session in bootloader mode, and it receives a request to change to default session (10 01), then the ICAS1 shall perform following sequence to change to default session in application mode:
- Send a negative response 0x78 (response pending) - Perform a reset
After startup - Sends the positive response 50 01 to acknowledge to the tester that the transition to default session is successful ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_140 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

IF the ICAS1 receives a SessionControl request, AND the checks are passed, AND the transition is allowed, AND the SuppressPositiveResponse bit in the request = 0
THEN the ICAS1 shall send following response, after changing to the target session Byte1: SID 0x50 Byte2: DiagnosticSessionType: 0x00-0x7F - The value of this field is the target session to which the ICAS1 just changed Byte3-Byte6: SessionParameterRecord
Remark: SessionParameterRecord contains following parameters:
Byte3-Byte4: P2server_Max as defined in [P2 server parameters]
Byte5-Byte6: P2*Server_Max as defined in [P2 server parameters] ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_141 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

If the ICAS1 receives the request 14 FF FF FF and all the checks are passed and the current active session is Default, ExtendedSession, EOL Session or DevelopmentSession
THEN the ICAS1 shall set the following data of all non-PermanentDTCs currently stored in memory:
StatusOfDTC to 0101 0000 (Reset value as described in Chapter [StatusofDTC Byte]) DTCExtendedData to zero All related flags, timers and counters to zero
Remark: the StatusOfDTC consist of 8 bits with the following information
Positive response: 0x54 (8 Bits)
None of the "ECU faulty"-related requirement is affected because the attribute "verlernen" in GW_Ereignisspeicher for every "ECU faulty" DTCs (Steuergerät defekt) is set to "nicht löschbar". ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_167 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

Where - DTCCount parameter contains the number of DTC which have at least one bit set to one, from those requested in DTCStatusMask (This means Bitmask OR operation between DTCStatusMask requested and the StatusOfDTC of each stored DTC, everytime the result is different from 0x00 -> DTCCount+1)

../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/test/swut/DiagAppl_DEM_ExtendedData.c.test line 269 Subfunction 0x06 ReportDTCExtendedDataRecordByDTCNumber
This subfunction is used to obtain the extended data for a DTC. There are two different sets of extended Data stored for each DTC, so this subfunction defines 2 sub-subfunctions to obtain each one of the extended data blocks as defined below.
When the ICAS1 receives following ReadDTCInformation request with subfunction 0x06 ReportDTCExtendedDataRecordByDTCNumber
The ICAS1 shall perform the checks defined in the chapter [Negative response codes] and respond with the corresponding NRC to the check wich failed, or with the positive response for the requested DTCExtendedDAtaRecordNumber as follows.
If DTCExtendedDataRecordNumber = 0x01, the ICAS1 provides information about DTC priority and OCC counter. If DTCExtendedDataRecordNumber = 0x02, the ICAS1 provides information about Aging counter, odometer and time stamp. If DTCExtendedDataRecordNumber > 0x02, the ICAS1 provides information about related measurement values as described in the corresponding requirement.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_185 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

The ICAS1 shall support the service 0x22 ReadDataByIdentifier with following purpose and characteristics: - This service is used to read the content of the requested DataIdentifier also called RDID. - This service has no subfunctions defined. - The bit SuppressPositiveResponseBit is not supported. - This service also works with KL15 OFF
Session: - The service 0x22 itself is allowed in all sessions. - Reading a RDID in a concrete session requires that the requested RDID has the rights to be read in the currently active session. The sessions in which it is allowed to read each RDID are listed in the corresponding requirement for the RDID.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_195 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_196
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: FUNC ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/inc/DiagAppl_DEM_ExtendedData.h line 911 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/test/swut/DiagAppl_DEM_ExtendedData.c.test line 387 Request:
The ICAS1 shall be able to respond to a ReadDatabyIdentifier request including up to 8 RDIDs in case the request is received - on the Diagnostic CAN via CAN ID 0x710 or 0x1C400010, - on the DoIP Eth Port with the target address 0x1010, otherwise up to 3 RDIDs
with the following format:
It is allowed to have the same RDID multiple times in one request.
The maximum number of RDIDs allowed in one request defined in this requirement is APPLICABLE of Both Application Mode and Bootloader Mode
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_196 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/test/swut/DiagAppl_Impl.c.test line 134 Request and processing
When the ICAS1 receives the following request:
then the ICAS1 shall perform the checks leading to the different NRC defined in this service´s [Negative Responses] chapter, and if some check fails, respond with the corresponding NRC if all checks are passed, enable/disable the Rx/Tx of all OnBoard communication messages (*) on the Networks defined in the CommunicationAndNetworkType parameter, as long as the [precondition/abort condition] are fulfilled. In the event that, during the execution, these are no longer fulfilled, the service will be aborted and the ICAS1 sends a NRC 0x22, and activate EnableRxAndTx
Remark:
where: - Subfunction ControlType defines the action (mainly enabling/disabling communication) requested, and is detailled separatelly for each possible value. - CommunicationAndNetworkType: This parameter limits the previous request - NodeIdentificationNumber will be received only for ControlType = 0x04 or 0x05.
(*) OnBoard Communication Messages means all messages except the following: - Messages for diagnosis communication - Network Management messages - Component protection messages (Additional function) - Routing
What exact messages shall not be suppressed in mute mode: diagnostic communication, network management, component protection, and immobilizer messages, as well as the messages used for the terminal 15 signal, must be further processed
- Diagnostic Messages; - NMH messages; - KN messages (containing status about component protection) - WFS_01 (Immobilizer); - message Klemmen_Status_01 (Terminal 15 signal) - Routing: every signal which is marked with 1:1 routing in routing table (column AT) shall NOT be suppressed in mute mode (according to Q-LAH_80124-7937) ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_211 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM

EnableRxAndDisableTx - ControlType 0x01 IF CRoute is receiving request 0x28 with ControlType 0x01 AND ORU_Status == Running OR Running_HV THEN CRoute shall not activate Mute Mode and respond with NRC 0x22 Conditions not Correct.
IF CRoute is receiving request 0x28 with ControlType 0x01 AND ORU_Status != Running AND ORU_Status != OR Running_HV THEN CRoute shall activate Mute Mode and provide positive response

Session and Security Access level The service itself is allowed in all sessions and does not require any security access level. sect2.title: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_258
sect2.para:
Requirement is satisfied here: FUNC ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/inc/DiagAppl_DEM_ExtendedData.h line 961 Requirement is verified here: TRACE ../../../../../../../../sw.sys.chorus_main_build/mc_sw/cdd/UDS_Services_Chorus/UDSServices/c/test/swut/DiagAppl_DEM_ExtendedData.c.test line 556 StopRoutine 0x02

simplesect.para: Requirement is not satisfied

Requirement is not verified StopRoutine 0x02
IF the ICAS1 receives a RoutineControl request with Subfunction StopRoutine 0x02 for a running routine AND the ICAS1 cannot stop the execution of the routine,
THEN the ICAS1 shall answer with NRC 0x22.
Remark: the routine which cannot be stopped by means of StopRoutine 0x02 should be found in the Routine_Grundeinstellung ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_259 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM
Requirement is not satisfied

Requirement is not verified RequestRoutineResults 0x03 When the ICAS1 receives a RoutineControl request with subfunction 0x03 for a routine which is running, or was executed during the current operation cycle, then the ICAS1 shall respond to the request with the positive response.
The Results of the execution of a routine are kept, and can be read via RequestRoutineResults until: - The routine is executed again - End of the OperationCycle
Note: If the routine was not started in the current operation cycle, the ICAS1 responds with NRC 0x24 (Described in Negative responses chapter) ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_260 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM
Requirement is not satisfied

Requirement is not verified 0x0102 Status der RoutineControl(s)
The ICAS1 shall allow the user of the tester tool to read the status of RoutineControl as defined in [Messwerte] as per following definition:
- 0xC0 if at least one routine is being executed - 0x00 if no routine is being executed
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_262 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM
Requirement is not satisfied

Requirement is not verified Routine Execution aborted due to session change.
IF there is a routine running, and the ICAS1 performs a session change to default session or a hard reset due to one of following reasons: - DiagnosticSessionControl to 0x01 - ECUReset - S3_Timeout
THEN the ICAS1 shall stop the execution of the routine.
Remark:
exceptions to this requirement are documented in [Routinen_Grundeinstellung]
The state-Diagramm of the Routine can be found in the figure below.
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_263 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM
Requirement is not satisfied

Requirement is not verified Positive response
When the ICAS1 sends a positive response to a RoutineControl Request, it shall send it with following format and following content depending on the Subfunction
For StartRoutine and StopRoutine, the ICAS1 sends only the first 4 Bytes For RequestRoutineResults, the ICAS1 sends also the Byte 5, and depending on the routine, also the RoutineStatusRecord.
Remark:
Definition of the Routine parameter name can be found on the LAH_Unified_Dagnostic_Services_Protocol - OBD_Service_80124
ID: SWR_ICAS1_Diag_265 _ObjectType: Requirement ASIL: QM
